titleStmt.title: Thomas Gray to Horace Walpole (c. 28 October 1760)

availability.p: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.
The original letter is extant and usually available for academic research purposes

listBibl.bibl: Correspondence of Thomas Gray, 3 vols. Ed. by the late Paget Toynbee and Leonard Whibley, with corrections and additions by H. W. Starr. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1971 [1st ed. 1935], letter no. 324, vol. ii, 708-709 http://www.e-enlightenment.com/search/letters/print/?printref_sourceedition=graythOU0084&printref_docnumber=324

The Correspondence of Gray, Walpole, West and Ashton (1734-1771), 2 vols. Chronologically arranged and edited with introduction, notes, and index by Paget Toynbee. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1915, letter no. 216, vol. ii, 206-207 https://www.thomasgray.org/texts/diglib/primary/TyP_1915ii/1/206

projectDesc.p: This letter is part of the Primary Texts section of the Thomas Gray Archive.
XML created for the Thomas Gray Archive.

editorialDecl.p: This letter is part of the correspondence calendar of the complete correspondence of Thomas Gray. The calendar contains detailed bibliographic records for all known original, copied, or published letters written by or to the poet as well as the full-text, where available. Each record is accompanied by digitised images of the manuscript, where available, or digitised images of the first printed edition.

taxonomy.bibl: Library of Congress Name Authority File (LCNAF)

body.p: Sr I have call'd two or three times at your house, but had not the luck to find you. I had in my pocket half a dozen Artisans for your book (tho' perhaps you may be already acquainted with them) they are Susan Hurembout, Levina Benich, two Paintresses in miniature, Torreggiano Torreggiani, Girolamo da Trevigi, Benedetto da Rovezzano, & Toto del Nunziata, Architects, Sculptors, & Painters, all of them employ'd in England by Henry 8th.
I wanted to ask also, if you would have the Wyatt-Papers now, as they are, that is, uncompared with the originals, & perhaps incorrect.

postscript.p: I hope, the new Reign agrees with you.
